name: A JMELSTON Quiz | Words in Words for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMELSTON", find a 3-letter word for a fast plane.
questions.explanation:
Jet.

	A jet is like a really fast plane.  There are many different kinds of jet.  "Jet" is also a deep shade of black.

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMELSTON", find a 3-letter word meaning a male offspring.
questions.explanation:
Son.

	A son is the male child of someone.  A female child would be called a daughter.

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMELSTON", find a 3-letter word for something weighing 2,200 pounds or 1,000 kilograms!
questions.explanation:
Ton.

	A ton is a lot of weight; about 2,200 pounds.  Another spelling of "ton" is "tonne", but you can't spell "tonne" out of "JMELSTON"!

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMELSTON", find a 3-letter word for a digit on your foot.
questions.explanation:
Toe.

	A toe is one of the digits on the foot.  Most people have ten toes; with five on each foot.  The big toe is called the "hallux".

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMELSTON", find a 5-letter word for a rock.
questions.explanation:
Stone.

	A stone is a type of rock.  Other words for "rock" include pebble, gravel, and boulder.  Stones are usually large in size.

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMELSTON", find a 3-letter word for a number.
questions.explanation:
One & Ten.

	Using letters in "JMELSTON", you can spell out two different numbers; ONE and TEN.  In the US, a penny is worth one cent, and a dime is worth ten cents.

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMELSTON", find a 4-letter word for an animal that goes underground, or a blemish on the skin.
questions.explanation:
Mole.

	A mole can be two things; it can be an animal or a skin blemish.  The animal is very small, and lives underground.  Some species eat worms.  A mole on the skin is like a freckle; but it isn't flat with the skin, it's like a raised bump.

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMELSTON", find a 5-letter word for a sour fruit with a yellow skin.
questions.explanation:
Lemon & Melon.

	A lemon is a citrus fruit that can be very sweet, but is usually very tart, or sour.  It is usually yellow in color.  Lemons are used to make lemonade.

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMELSTON", find a 4-letter word meaning the opposite of found.
questions.explanation:
Lost.

	If something is lost, you cannot find it.  Some places have a "lost and found", which is where things that people have lost go to so the owners can go there to find what they have lost.  "Lost" was also the name of a TV show.

questions.text: Using only letters in "JMELSTON", find a 3-letter word for something you might catch fish or butterflies with.
questions.explanation:
Net.

	A net can be used for many things, like catching fish or butterflies.  Nets come in all different sizes, and can be made from many different materials, like rope.
